greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal exponent in prime factorization of n.
comment: The asymptotic mean of this sequence is 1 (Niven, 1969). - _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 10 2020
link: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
Ivan Niven, Averages of Exponents in Factoring Integers, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., Vol. 22, No. 2 (1969), pp. 356-360.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Niven's Constant
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: a(1) = 0, for n > 1, if A001221(n) = 1 (when n is in A000961), a(n) = A001222(n), otherwise a(n) = min(A067029(n), a(A028234(n))). - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 12 2017
maple: a := proc (n) if n = 1 then 0 else min(seq(op(2, op(j, op(2, ifactors(n)))), j = 1 .. nops(op(2, ifactors(n))))) end if end proc: seq(a(n), n = 1 .. 100); # _Emeric Deutsch_, May 20 2015
mathematica: Table[If[n == 1, 0, Min @@ Last /@ FactorInteger[n]], {n, 100}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Jan 24 2006 *)
program: a051904 n = minimum $ a124010_row n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 15 2012
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 13 2017
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 16 1999
